meeting_request.purpose: Help deciding between graduate school and working in environmental policy or academia
meeting_request.description: Hi, I’m Sheryl, a senior majoring in Earth & Environmental Geosciences. I’ve taken a lot of interesting courses, from climate change to geology to environmental policy. I’ve even interned with a nonprofit and really enjoyed it. But now I’m thinking about graduate school or working in environmental policy or academia. I don’t know which path would be best for me, and I’m feeling a bit overwhelmed. I want advice about whether to pursue graduate school right now or if I should take a year off and explore more options before applying. I also feel like the major I chose is not explicitly focused on policy, and I don’t want to end up doing something that doesn’t align with my long-term goals.
